item.title: Marked Pothole not fixed, 15th October
item.description:
I recently opened a ticket regarding pot holes that were marked for repair months ago, that haven't been fixed. You immediately closed this saying work had been done. It hasn't. There are still marked potholes that haven't been fixed. They are on prestbury rd on the lane leading from the roundabout going towards prestbury.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 40 Prestbury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing road lanes sign from this junction, 15th October
item.description:
All the other junctions have signs clearly showing which lane to be in before entering the roundabout.... apart from this one. Weirdly, this one doesn't have one and it causes mass confusion for anyone that doesn't drive the route often. People contently have to change lanes at the last minute or cut across lanes on the roundabout, it's just plain dangerous. There's a signs with the picture of the roundabout on but no sign showing what direction each lane is for. This junction really needs one of these signs instead of stupidly having to guess which lane to be in beforehand and then finding out 6ft before the roundabout you're in the wrong lane when you see the writing painted on the floor (if you can see it under the queue of traffic). I would post a picture of one of the signs from a different junction but the website doesn't have the option to attach pictures on this report
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Longlevens
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Series of temporary 40 mph speed signs, 15th October
item.description:
There was a previous temporary 40mph limit in the section but that trial period ended many months ago. Since then it seems to be temporary signs are regularly being replaced for no reason. Now the signs state “road works” but there are no works - another sign says “temporary limit for 18 months” which looks like the old sign from 2 years ago.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Capel Orchard London Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speed bump, 14th October
item.description:
Fiddlers green lane has speed bumps going down which is the road backing our garden and every time a large vehicle or a car that is doing way over the speed limit goes over the bump the whole house shakes. The speed bump is directly opposite our house. This has always done it even before the golden valley work was set in place. I’m started to get concerned as it’s effecting the house structure as we have noticed cracks on that side of the house going up the house. Like I said the whole house does shake and our windows make a noise as well and when that’s happening a lot through the day and night every day I really don’t think it’s doing the house foundations any good. Our garden wall that is closer to the speed bump the brick has fallen off with others wobbling and the whole wall on that side now moves yet the other side doesn’t do that. I can’t see the traffic being any less when road works are done as we get so much traffic at any times through the night. Not only this it is the loud thud sound that follows after. It also doesn’t reduce any speed. I think a slow down sign would be a lot more effective leading up to the sharp corner with the speed bump removed. Also, barriers on the green verge backing the houses on nunney close would be in favour as the amount of cars that have lost control on the bend and one of our neighbours had a car go through their garden wall and nothing has been put into place to prevent that from happening again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 NUNNY, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and noise pollution from Rowanfield exchange shops shops, 13th October
item.description:
Yeah air-conditioning and refrigeration units are in a poor state of repair. This means that they are making excessive noise for the residents. Multipack wrappers from the shop all littering the planted area at the back infront of the houses again affecting the residents. Please ask environmental health or the neighbourhood team to investigate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 10 Cornwall Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
